data.title: Good drinks & atmosphere, poor service
data.text: Been here only twice, both times in the past three months. It was the same story both times. They make good drinks. My wife and I like almost all iterations of whiskey but especially bourbon. The list is good and cocktails are good. It's rarely absolutely packed but it is usually bustling, which makes for good ambiance, along with dim lighting and a lot of brick, wood, and bourbon paraphernalia. The service leaves much to be desired. Very much. Both times we were quickly greeted but the attentiveness stopped there. Slow to get drinks we ordered, very slow to offer a second and/or third round, and very slow to bring a tab. Not just slow, but unaware. Both times we were in the highest traffic area of the place (by the servers' entrance/exit from behind the bar) and were repeatedly passed by our server without a single look toward our empty glasses or any eye contact. Basic service skills being missed. I can handle a server who is just in the weeds or an understaffed bar because someone called in, but the idea of glancing at your guests' tables as you pass and/or checking on them is service 101 and is not understood here. We will begrudgingly return because it's across the street from the theater or because we want a nightcap after dinner nearby, but it's not somewhere we'll seek out because we know the service will likely be subpar.

data.title: Great Bourbon Cocktails
data.text:
My husband and I stopped in at the Horse and Barrel during our stay at the 21C Museum Hotel.  It is just a few doors down and they serve great bourbon cocktails and have an extensive bourbon selection.

The bartender was very nice and she sure knows how to make a drink. We'll be sure to stop in again the next time we're in Cincinnati.

data.title: Great bourbon and small plates
data.text: Knowledgable staff with great selection of bourbons. While my husband likes straight bourbon I prefer a mixed drink. The bourbon sour was great. Definitely try the blue cheese dip. Very friendly staff. Loved it!

data.title: Great bourbon selection but lots of service issues
data.text:
We stopped by Horse and Barrel last night for after-meal drinks when we finished dining at Boca down the street.  This is a charming place (next to Nicholson's) that has a great bourbon menu.  The prices are reasonable for a downtown bourbon bar but the services were very disappointing.

First, there are no serving staff and only 2 bartenders.  So you will likely wait 5-10 minutes to order your drinks.  Second, at midnight the only computer in the bar went down and no more drinks were served.  Even when we offered to pay cash for future drinks, the bartender impatiently refused.

I hope the management works out these issues as many patrons in the bar talked about their disappointing experience and would likely not return for a long time.
